title: Tony Bellew gatecrashes Jake Paul vs Mike Tyson press conference with potential new challenger
body_text:
Boxing
DAZN
Ash Rose
Watch Zurdo vs. Billam-Smith Saturday FREE on DAZN
The boxing world has its full attention on Friday's massive showdown between Jake Paul and icon of the sport, Mike Tyson, but a familiar face is already looking toward Paul's next opponent.
Tyson will step back in the ring for the first time since 2005 when he goes head-to-head with Paul in Texas, but as the pair were previewing the big encounter at yesterday's press conference, they were interpreted by former British boxer Tony Bellew.
Bellew, with mic in hand, interrupted a journalist who was about to ask Tyson a question to aim his own query at Jake Paul. Calling the former YouTube star a 'clown', Bellew comically challenged the 28-year-old on behalf of who he believes should be his next opponent - a 107-year-old great grandfather!
Parading alongside Bellew in full robe and gloves, Bellew paraded the elderly gentleman and told Paul - as well as the watching audience - that the 'great grandfather' should be his next opponent.
He said: "Jake Paul, the biggest clown in boxing if Mike lets you survive on Saturday night, then I've got your next opponent here, mate. I've got a great-grandfather. This guy's got two new hips, and at 107, he's ready for you!"
The organisers quickly shut down Bellew's stunt, but it lasted long enough to appear on social media and raise the question of a possible comeback for the 41-year-old - possibly against Paul.
